text: Hey, anyone here manages the JuliaGraphs project? I'm developing a package called VegaGraphs, which is built on top of GraphPlot and plots graphs using VegaLite. Hence, the visualization allows for interactivity, such as hovering, tooltips, etc. I was wondering how to make the package part of the JuliaGraphs project (if the owners of the project find the package worth it, of course).

elements.text: Hey, anyone here manages the JuliaGraphs project? I'm developing a package called VegaGraphs, which is built on top of GraphPlot and plots graphs using VegaLite. Hence, the visualization allows for interactivity, such as hovering, tooltips, etc. I was wondering how to make the package part of the JuliaGraphs project (if the owners of the project find the package worth it, of course).

text:
I do not know the answer, but I am looking forward for your lib. I have quikly created this
<https://github.com/pevnak/VisNetwork.jl>
but it was more of a quick fix than full solution

text: Cool! Do you have ideas if features you think would be interesting?

elements.text: Cool! Do you have ideas if features you think would be interesting?

text: Right now, the package is very similar to GraphPlots, but wrapped with VegaLite. So you can already produce the graphs with all the available layouts, change node codes, add tooltips, node size, edge size, etc.

elements.text: Right now, the package is very similar to GraphPlots, but wrapped with VegaLite. So you can already produce the graphs with all the available layouts, change node codes, add tooltips, node size, edge size, etc.
